solution: Let $x= \log_{\sqrt{6}}(216\sqrt{6})$.  Putting this in exponential notation gives $(\sqrt{6})^x = 216\sqrt{6}$.  Writing both sides with $6$ as the base gives us $6^{\frac{x}{2}} = 6^3\cdot 6^{\frac{1}{2}} = 6^{\frac{7}{2}}$, so $x/2=7/2$.  Therefore, $x=\boxed{7}$.
chatgpt_solution: First we could write $216$ and $\sqrt{6}$ both with base $\sqrt{6}$.  We have $216=(\sqrt{6})^3$, so now our expression has a base of $\sqrt{6}$.  The expression $\log_{\sqrt{6}}(\sqrt{6})$ equals $1$, because the $\log_b b =1$ for all $b\neq 1$.  Hence, $\log_{\sqrt{6}}(216\sqrt{6}) = \log_{\sqrt{6}}( (\sqrt{6})^3 (\sqrt{6}) ) = \log_{\sqrt{6}}((\sqrt{6})^4)$.  Since $\log_a (a^n) = n$, this equals $4$, so $\log_{\sqrt{6}} (216\sqrt{6}) = \boxed{4}$.
